First of all: Thanks a LOT for making this, I had thought of having a crack at this myself for a while but never got around to it. It works beautifully with my (original!) Logitech G15.

I do have one request though: the plugin often grabs focus on the LCD, on every scene change I think. Especially when I'm not flying (but switching between buildings for example) I don't need to be reminded that it's "waiting for flight...". I often switch to other things (media player control, system status/performance monitor) and it re-grabs the LCD. I can see it grabbing focus when a flight is started, but for the "waiting"-screen it's really not necessary.
I installed it and ran the game, but nothing happend (I have a G510).

It should just work, there is no need to configure anything. DMcLgLCD.dll needs to be in the same place as KSP.exe (as MK3424 said already) and obviously the GHud folder in the GameData folder, as usual with mods. Have you checked the Logitech control panel if it is just set to not be displayed for some reason?
Turns out I had an old version of the Logitech software installed, I updated it and now it works

Currently kerbal doesnt support dual monitor setup - and many people proposed this, so player woudl be able to watch flight on first screen and orbtal map on second.

You managed to render simple 2d map on mini-screen of keyboard. So, theoretically it shoudl be possible to re-render orbital map and display it on second monitor instead small lcd screen..

Some external program woudl be probably needed, as i need keyboard fimware/emulator (i dont own keyboard with screen, so i tested your mod on emulator) to handle viewing map.

Or instead sending pre rendered image of map to external device/app, send only orbit data (like telemachus probably does), and let app handle rendering map... After all KSP has limited resources usage, until 64 bit version comes out.

Such rendered map maybe coudl bein real 3d, with ability do rotate it, zoom in and out. Although controlling it while manevouring your ship coudl be tricky.
